conclusion: Use principles of optics, laws of refraction, and relationship between angles of incidence and refraction to determine speed of light in material.
Identify given information: ratio of radius is 1:2, incident angle is 45 degrees, light includes red, green, purple, green light tangent to inner wall.
Angle of incidence equals angle of refraction for green light, thus angle of incidence is 45 degrees.
Use law of refraction: ratio of refractive index to speed of light is constant for same color light, refractive index for green light is greater than red light.
Radius of ball is 2r, radius of hollow part is r.
Speed of light in vacuum is c, speed in transparent material is v.
Using law of refraction: v_g/c = n_g/n_r and v_g/c = 1/2.
Speed of light v in transparent material is 1/2 c.
Speed of D (purple light) is also 1/2 c.
Speed of D (purple light) is smallest among the three.
Therefore, speed of D (purple light) is the smallest.
